intro: Hieracium pallidum subsp. subvandasii, commonly known as the pale hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellowish to pale green flowers and is native to specific regions in Europe. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and forest edges. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces achenes as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and sometimes endangered species.
